site_name: Cromer Court, Lytham Court, St David's Court
description: Demolition of existing buildings, including the stairwell serving the southern part of Portrush Court, and erection of four rows of three-storey terrace dwellinghouses (one part two-storey) comprising 6 x three-bed, 11 x four-bed and 5 x five-bed houses; 4 co-joined part single and two-storey three-bed houses and a part three, five and six storey block of 34 flats (10 x one-bed, 20 x two-bed, 2 x three-bed and 2 x four-bed) with gardens, landscaping, 18 car-parking spaces, cycle parking, alteration to vehicle and pedestrian access and associated works, including the re-provision of a stairwell serving Portrush Court (Deemed Consent)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:  Drawings: 2996-D- 001 P3, 002 P6, 003 P1, 010 P7, 011 P2, 012 P3, 013 P3, 014 P2, 015 P3, 016 P3, 030 P1, 031 P1, 032 P2, 050 P2, 051 P2, 052 P2, 053 P2, 054 P2, 055 P2, 060 P2, 061 P2, 062 P2, 063 P2, 064 P2; 2996_L_901 P2, 902 P2, 903 P2.   Documents: Planning Statement, 24 July 2012, prepared by Arc Planning; Design and Access Statement, July 2012, prepared by Levitt Bernstein; Statement of Community Involvement, July 2012, prepared by Levitt Bernstein; Affordable Housing Statement (received 20/09/2012); Code for Sustainable Homes (November 2010) Pre-Assessment Report (Job No: 25457), 2 July 2012, prepared by Baily Garner; Energy Strategy Report (Job No: 25457), 03 July 2012 and Issue 02 dated 11 September 2012; Additional Information responding the Energy Officer comments dated 11 September 2012 & 21 September 2012; Foul & Surface Water Drainage Strategy (Doc Ref: SJC/614596/JRC), 20 July 2012, prepared by MLM Consulting Engineers Ltd; Transport Statement Rev A (Doc Ref: 614600), 12 July 2012, prepared by MLM Consulting Engineers Ltd.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details of a site construction method statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The submission shall include the following: a) The number of on-site construction workers and details of the transport options and parking facilities for them; b) anticipated route, anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site per day; c) delivery times and booking system (which is to be staggered to avoid morning and afternoon peak periods); d) route and location of site access for construction traffic and associated signage; e) management of consolidated or re-timed trips; f) details of the noise / vibration and dust mitigation measures to accord with the 'Best Practice Guidance: The control of dust and emissions from construction and demolition ' (2006) and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites - Part 1:Noise; g) wheel washing provision; h) details of site security and the erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate. i) secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities; j) vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how construction vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear and including details of any temporary vehicle access points; k) details of the location(s) for storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices; l) procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from members of the public; m) measures to consult cyclists, disabled people and the local schools with regard  to delivery times and necessary diversions; n) details of all pedestrian and cyclist diversions; o) a commitment to be part of Considerate Constructors Scheme; and p) confirmation of use of TfL's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar  Prior to the commencement of any site work, all sensitive properties surrounding the site shall be notified in writing of the nature and duration of the works to be undertaken, and the name and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.  Reason:  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with policies 5.18, 6.3 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(f) and 1.1(j) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 4.4, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the provision of SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | Prior to the commencement of the development a Site Waste Management Plan including a Green Procurement Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Site Waste Management Plan and Green Procurement Plan shall demonstrate how the procurement of materials for the development will promote sustainability, including by use of low impact, sustainably sourced, reused and recycled materials, including reuse of demolition waste (where available), use of local suppliers and by reference to the BRE's Green Guide Specification.   The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the particulars so approved.  Reason:  To ensure sustainable procurement of materials which minimises the negative environmental impacts of construction in accordance with policies 5.3 and 5.18 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 2.1 and 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details and samples of all facing materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any work commencing on the superstructure of the development.  The samples and details shall include:  a) brickwork (including brick panels and mortar courses); b) cladding materials; c) all window treatments (including sections and reveals); d) building entrance details and material samples; e) balcony structures and balustrading treatment (including sections);  f) privacy screen treatment to balconies;  g) bin store and bicycle store entrance doors / ventilation louvres;  h) any other materials to be used.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.   Reason:  In the interest of securing sustainable development and to ensure that the resulting appearance of the development is of a high standard in accordance with policies: 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(h), 1.1(k), 1.2(f), 1.2(h) and 4.1 of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the privacy screen(s) separating the roof terraces and balconies of the approved houses shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 6 months of the commencement of the development   The screens shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and the development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and shall be maintained as such thereafter.   Reason:  To prevent undue overlooking (oblique, backwards or otherwise) of neighbouring habitable room windows, balconies and roof terraces and also to ensure that the resulting privacy screen / balustrade is acceptable in terms of its appearance in accordance with policies: 7.4 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The demolition of the existing Portrush Court (south) communal core shall not commence until the necessary alternative access arrangements for the occupiers of Portrush Court allowing access to the Portrush Court (north) stair and passenger lift, are put in place.   Reason:  To ensure that the occupiers of Portrush Court have continuous access to their properties. | Notwithstanding the details submitted within the Design and Access Statement (prepared by Levitt Berstein) and as indicated on drawings 2996-D-010 P7, 2996_L_901 P2, 902 P2, 903 P2; a landscaping and public realm scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the superstructure works commencing. The landscaping and public realm scheme shall include details of the front and rear garden landscaping, roof terraces (intensive green roofs) and balconies, communal amenity spaces, and new areas of public realm, including the Home Zone. The landscaping scheme shall include the following information:   a) a biodiversity statement detailing how the landscaping scheme maximises biodiversity, including the provision of bat, bird, bee and insect boxes where practicable; b) existing and proposed underground services and their relationship to both hard and soft landscaping; c) proposed trees: their location, species and size; d) soft plantings: including grass and turf areas, wildflower, shrub and herbaceous areas; e) topographical survey: including earthworks, ground finishes, top soil with both conserved and imported topsoil, levels and drainage;  f) enclosures and boundary treatments, including types, dimensions and finishes of walls, fences, balcony privacy screens, barriers, rails, retaining walls and hedges; g) hard landscaping including the Home Zone surfacing: including ground surfaces, kerbs, tactile paving, edges, unit paving, seating and other furniture, steps and, if applicable, synthetic surfaces (being mindful of the requirements in relation to sustainable urban drainage solutions);  h) rainwater harvesting technologies for use in the landscape;  i) any other landscaping feature(s) forming part of the scheme; j) a management and maintenance strategy; and k) work phasing plan.  All soft landscaping shall be completed / planted during the first planting season following practical completion of the development hereby approved, or in accordance with the approved work phasing plan (k).  Any trees or shrubs that die within five years of the anniversary of planting shall be replaced with the same species or an approved alternative in the next planting season.  The Home Zone shall be designed and constructed to adoptable standards and all hard landscaping and boundary treatments shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and completed prior to the first occupation of the development.   Reason:  To ensure the approved landscaping is provided as an integral feature of the development and that all such landscaping, boundary treatments and street furniture is retained in the interests of the setting of the buildings and visual amenities of the locality; to provide biodiversity within the site and to ensure that the use of mains water in the landscape areas is reduced through the incorporation of rainwater harvesting technologies; and to ensure that the Home Zone is designed to be safe for all users, including people who are visually impaired or disabled; in accordance with policies 5.10, 5.15, 6.1, 6.10, 7.2, 7.3, 7.4, 7.5, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(h), 1.1(i), 1.1(k), 1.2(f) and 1.2(m) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 3.8, 4.1, 4.5, 5.5, 9.1, 9.7 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The biodiversity roofs shall be provided in accordance with approved drawings 2996-D-016 Rev P3; 2996_L_901 P2; 2996_L_903 P2, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The biodiversity roofs shall comprise the following:   a) biodiversity based with extensive substrate base (depth 80-150mm);  b) sufficient depth of soil or growing medium for the relevant planting, including the re-use of any demolition material where feasible; c) planted / seeded with a mix of species within the first planting season following the practical completion of the building works. The seed mix shall be focused on wildflower planting and shall contain no more than 25% sedum; d) relevant efficient and effective drainage and irrigation to sustain the vegetation.  The biodiversity roofs shall not be used as an amenity or sitting out area and shall only be accessed in the case of essential maintenance or repair.  The biodiversity roofs shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development to which the biodiversity roofs relate.   Reason:  To ensure the development provides the maximum possible provision towards the creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.10, 5.11, 5.12 and 7.19 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(m) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and 3.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The car parking as indicated on the approved drawing 2996-D-010 Rev P7, including a minimum of 6 parking spaces suitable for wheelchair users shall be marked out and completed together with the associated access roads and manoeuvring areas prior to the first occupation of the development and these areas shall be kept continuously available for car parking associated with the residential development and shall not be used for any other purposes.  Reason: To ensure adequate car parking is provided and retained in conjunction with the development in the interests of the general amenities of the locality and the free flow of traffic and conditions of pedestrian and general highway safety on the neighbouring highways in accordance with policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f) and 1.1(g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 4.1, 5.5 and 9.1 of the of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A minimum of 20% of the parking spaces within the Home Zone shall be equipped with active charging points for electric vehicles with an additional 20% of spaces equipped with passive charging provision prior to the first occupation of the development.  Reason: In the interest of the environment and improving air quality, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 1.2(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | Within four-months of the commencement of development a draft Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. As part of the Travel Plan measures, the introduction of a car club vehicle within the application site shall be further investigated and evidence of this investigation shall be submitted with the draft Travel Plan.   A final detailed Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development. A car club vehicle shall be provided in accordance with the approved details if such provision is found to be viable.   The final Travel Plan shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any part of the development.   Reason: In the interest of supporting measures that encourage shifts to more sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies 6.1 and 6.3 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(f), 1.1(g), 1.1(j) and 1.1(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 9.1 and 9.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and SPG 21: Sustainable Transport - Green Travel Plans. | No part of the development shall be occupied until a raised table has been constructed at the junction of the approved Home Zone and Dormers Rise, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  NOTE: The applicant should contact the Local Highways Authority to discuss the requirements in respect of entering into an agreement under Section 278 of the Highways Act 1980, which is separate from this planning permission.  Reason: To ensure the necessary traffic calming measures are put in place in the interests of providing safe conditions for pedestrians using the Home Zone; in accordance with policies 6.1, 6.10, 7.2 and 7.5 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(e) and 1.1(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 9.1, 9.7 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the approved plans and documents, prior to the commencement of the superstructure works revised details of the design of the bicycle storage facilities shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.  The bicycle storage facilities shall be provided in accordance with the details so approved and be ready for use prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development which the store serves.  Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking storage is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles, and to ensure that the design and location of the bicycle storage areas does not detract from the design and appearance of the proposed development and also does not visually dominate the forecourt of the approved houses;  in accordance with policies 6.9, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1(h), 1.1(g) and1.1(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 5.5 and 9.1 and of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The dedicated refuse / recycling enclosures illustrated on approved drawing 2996-D-010 P6 shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development which the enclosure serves.   Reason:  To secure the necessary recycling and waste enclosures to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and SPG 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | The residential units shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, in accordance with the Design and Access Statement and the plans hereby approved.  Reason:  To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate to the changing needs of the future occupiers, in accordance with policy 3.5, 3.8, 3.9 and 7.2 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | The six wheelchair accessible units shall be constructed to conform to the guidance set out within the Habinteg Wheelchair Housing Design Guide (Second Edition), in accordance with the Design and Access Statement and plans hereby approved.   Reason:  To ensure the provision of wheelchair housing that would address the current unmet housing need; produce a sustainable mix of accommodation; and provide appropriate choices and housing opportunities for wheelchair users and their families, in accordance with policies: 3.5, 3.8, 3.9 and 7.2 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and SPG 7: Accessible Ealing. | The passenger lifts located within the communal cores serving the approved flat building and Portrush Court (south) shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the flatted development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason:  To ensure that adequate access is provided to all floors of the development for all occupiers and visitors including those with disabilities, in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.8, and 7.2 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 5.3 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Internal noise levels of the residential units, due to external noise or noise from other parts of the development should not exceed the following:   Bedrooms (23:00 to 07:00 Hrs): 30 dB LAeq, 45 dB LAmax for individual noise events   Living rooms (0700 to 2300 Hrs): 35 dB LAeq.   Kitchens, bathrooms, WC compartments & utility rooms (0700 to 2300 Hrs): 50 dB LAeq.   [NB: All time intervals are 1 hour, time weighting is fast unless stated. Note: The levels above are recommended by the World Health Organisation and incorporated within BS8233 1999: Sound Insulation and Noise Reduction for Buildings - Code of Practice.  Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for future occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and the Council's SPG10: Noise and Vibration. | Details to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from the proposed plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, will be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority within 6 months of the commencement of the superstructure works. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for future occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and the Council's SPG10: Noise and Vibration. | Details of site-wide security measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development.  The details shall relate to:  a) CCTV; b) general lighting; and/or   c) security lighting   The details shall include the location and full specification of: all lamps; light levels/spill; cameras (detailing view paths); and support structures.    The proposed external lighting scheme shall comply with the advice given at BS 5389 Part 9, with regards to upward light and light pollution and lighting of public amenity areas and ILE guidance on Reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2005.  The general security measures shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development.   Reason:  To ensure that the security lighting and CCTV cameras are appropriately located and designed to not unduly affect the residential amenity of the occupiers of the development and neighbouring properties; are appropriate to the overall design of the development and are adequate to promote safety and security, in accordance with policies 7.3, 7.6 and 7.13 of the London Plan 2011, policy 1.1(e) and 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 4.1, 4.4 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the Council's SPG 8: Safer Ealing. | Details of security features relating to each of the communal residential entrance(s) of the flatted development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within six months of the commencement of the superstructure works. The security details shall relate to:  a) location, access and design of post-boxes, which should be external (unless otherwise agreed with the Local Planning Authority); and b) design, location and details of entry systems.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and maintained as such thereafter.  The agreed security features shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development.  Reason:  To ensure that the security details relating to the residential communal entrances are appropriate and adequately secure in accordance with policies: 7.2 and 7.3 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(e) and 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and 4.1, 4.4 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of any microwave masts, antennae, satellite dish or any other plant or equipment to be located on the external part of any of the buildings shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development.   Reason:  To safeguard the appearance of the buildings in the interests of visual amenity; in accordance with policies 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 4.1, 4.14 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provision of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) no development to any dwellinghouse hereby approved under Classes A, B, C, D or, E of Part 1, Schedule 2 to the said Order shall be carried out or constructed without express planning permission.   Reason:  To enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain control over extensions and other alterations to dwellinghouses in the interests of the design and character of the properties, the visual amenities of the locality and amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011, policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1(h), 1.2(f) and 2.10 of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | The development hereby approved shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4 (as deemed relevant under the registered version). Within six months of the commencement of the development, evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) (or similar approved body) under the Code for Sustainable Homes and an Interim Code for Sustainable Homes Assessment and Interim Design Certificates shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.  Post Construction Code for Sustainable Homes certificates shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority as soon as practically possible following completion of construction and prior to the first occupation of the development. In the event that certificates are outstanding from the approved body, a copy of the completed report shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority confirming the sustainability measures achieved and the certificates forwarded to the Local Planning Authority as soon as practicable following this.     Reason:  To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1 (k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and 2.1; 4.1; and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The details of the layout and array of photovoltaic panels, which shall provide for no less than 51kWp of electricity as detailed within the approved Energy Strategy Report (Job No: 25457), 03 July 2012 and Issue 02 dated 11 September 2012; Additional Information responding the Energy Officer comments dated 11 & 21 September 2012 and 02 October 2012, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within three months of the commencement of the development.  The photovoltaic panels shall thereafter be installed in accordance with the approved details and operational prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development.  Reason:  In the interest of sustainable development and combating climate change in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.7, and 5.8 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and 2.9 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development hereby approved shall be provided in 100% affordable housing tenure, as defined at Appendix 2 of the National Planning Policy Framework, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is provided in accordance with the approved plans and documents and in order that the development meets the requirements of policies 3.11, 3.12, 3.13 and 3.14 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 1.2(a) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, which requires the maximum reasonable amount of affordable housing is sought in new developments that provide 10 or more units; that at least 50% of the housing developed in the borough up to 2026 will be affordable housing; and to ensure that there is no additional loss of affordable housing from the site above the amount already considered as part of the application.
site_number: Cromer Court, Lytham Court, St Davids Court
